abstract.text: An object that provides information about a field in a structure.

inlineContent.text: is part of the reflection API that allows Metal framework code to query details about an argument of a Metal shading language function. A
object describes the data type of one field in a struct that is passed as a
object tells you what kind of data is stored in the member. Recursively drill down every struct member until you reach a data type that is neither a struct nor an array.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
Information about an argument of a graphics or compute function.
A description of an array.
The types of GPU functions, including shaders and compute kernels.
An object that represents a public shader function in a Metal library.
A description of a pointer.
An object that provides information about a field in a structure.
The index in the argument table that corresponds to the struct member.
Provides a description of the underlying array when the struct member holds an array.
The data type of the struct member.
The name of the struct member.
The location of this member relative to the start of its struct, in bytes.
Provides a description of the underlying pointer when the struct member holds a pointer.
Provides a description of the underlying struct when the struct member holds a struct.
Provides a description of the underlying texture when the struct member holds a texture.
A description of a structure.
Provides a representation of a struct member.
An array of objects that describe the fields in the struct.
A description of a texture.
A description of a data type.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
